Class ControllerExhibit

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.classes.ControllerExhibit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IControllerExhibit

    public class ControllerExhibit
extends java.lang.Object
implements IControllerExhibit
    The controller for the ExhibitView.
    Author:
    Elisa Casadio

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void commandArtwork(int index, javax.swing.JFrame frame)
      Open a new view where is shown the archive of the artworks and the artworks exposed in the selected exhibit.
      void commandClose(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
      Checks that no exhibit has artworks assigned, otherwise shows an error message and obstructs the closing of the view.
      void commandDelete(int index, javax.swing.JFrame frame)
      Deletes the selected exhibit from the view and from the model by asking the user for confirmation.
      void commandEdit(int index, javax.swing.JFrame frame)
      Show a form setted with the informations of the selected exhibit in the table to permit the modification of the informations.
      void commandNew(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
      Show a new empty form to add a new exhibit to the archive of the exhibits of the art gallery.

      • commandEdit

        public void commandEdit(int index,
                        javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        Description copied from interface: IControllerExhibit
        Show a form setted with the informations of the selected exhibit in the table to permit the modification of the informations. Show an error message if the user wants to edit the exhibit's information when the exhibit has already started.
        Specified by:
        commandEdit in interface IControllerExhibit
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the exhibit in the list.
        frame - the frame of the view.

      • commandDelete

        public void commandDelete(int index,
                          javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        Description copied from interface: IControllerExhibit
        Deletes the selected exhibit from the view and from the model by asking the user for confirmation. Show an error message if the user wants to delete the exhibit when the exhibit has already started.
        Specified by:
        commandDelete in interface IControllerExhibit
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the exhibit in the list.
        frame - the frame of the view.

      • commandClose

        public void commandClose(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        Description copied from interface: IControllerExhibit
        Checks that no exhibit has artworks assigned, otherwise shows an error message and obstructs the closing of the view. If there aren't exhibits without artworks assigned, closes the frame and saves the model in to a file. Show an error message if the writing fails.
        Specified by:
        commandClose in interface IControllerExhibit
        Parameters:
        frame - the frame of the view.
